title: Superagency: Are You Ready?
description: Prepare yourself for the Superagency Challenge by understanding what it means to work WITH AI, not just use it.

settings.skipNudgeMessage: This helps prepare you for the assignment. Skip anyway?

questions.prompt: What does 'Superagency' mean in the context of this course?
options: Being better than AI at everything
The ability to tackle problems that were previously beyond your reach, using AI as a cognitive partner
Letting AI do all the work while you supervise
Learning to code AI systems from scratch
questions.hint: Think about what 'super' adds to 'agency' — it's about expanding what YOU can do.
questions.explanation: Superagency isn't about replacing your thinking with AI — it's about amplifying your capabilities. You become able to attempt problems that would have been out of reach before.

questions.prompt: When working with AI as a 'cognitive partner,' your role is to:
options: Accept whatever the AI suggests without question
Only use AI for tasks you don't want to do yourself
Bring judgment, context, and direction — things AI can't provide on its own
Avoid sharing your own ideas so the AI isn't biased
questions.hint: What can you bring to the partnership that AI cannot?
questions.explanation: You bring the 'why' — the understanding of context, stakeholders, and what actually matters. AI brings capability, but you bring judgment about how to use it.

questions.prompt: For your Superagency Challenge, match each problem type with whether it's a good fit:

pairs.left: A real problem you actually care about solving
Something impressive but you don't really need solved
pairs.right: Poor choice — you won't learn as much

pairs.left: A problem where you'll learn something even if it fails
The easiest possible problem to guarantee success
pairs.right: Poor choice — too safe, no growth

questions.hint: The best problems are ones where you're genuinely invested in the outcome.

questions.prompt: During the Superagency Challenge, how should you approach using AI?
options: Use AI only for the parts you can't do yourself
Have AI do everything, then review its work
Work iteratively WITH AI — direct, evaluate, refine, and apply your judgment throughout
Avoid AI until you're stuck, then ask for help
questions.explanation: Symbiotic thinking means ongoing collaboration. You're not delegating TO AI or using AI as a last resort — you're thinking TOGETHER throughout the process.

questions.prompt: The purpose of documenting your Superagency Challenge is to:
questions.template: Reflection helps you {{purpose}}, which is more valuable than just {{notpurpose}}.

options: understand what you learned and how you learned it
prove you did the work
show off to your classmates
get a good grade
purpose.correct: understand what you learned and how you learned it

options: completing the task
using AI
getting help
taking notes

questions.hint: What's the difference between doing something and learning from doing something?

questions.prompt: Brainstorm 2-3 real problems in your life that you might tackle for the Superagency Challenge. For each, briefly explain: (1) Why you care about solving it, and (2) Why it might have been too hard to attempt before AI.
questions.placeholder: Example: 'I want to organize my family's old photos by date and location. I care because my grandmother wants to see them organized before she passes. It would have taken weeks manually, but with AI I might be able to do it in a few hours.'

questions.prompt: After completing the Superagency Challenge, you'll write a 'Human Value Statement.' What does this capture?
options: How much time AI saved you
The specific moments where YOUR judgment, knowledge, or decisions made the difference in the outcome
A list of all the AI tools you used
Technical details about how the AI worked
questions.hint: If AI could have done it completely alone, what would YOUR value have been?
questions.explanation: The Human Value Statement helps you articulate where humans remain essential — the judgment calls, contextual understanding, and decisions that AI couldn't make on its own.

questions.prompt: What's one concern or uncertainty you have about the Superagency Challenge? Being honest about uncertainties is the first step to addressing them.
questions.placeholder: It's completely normal to have concerns. Maybe you're worried about picking the right problem, not knowing how to work with AI effectively, or feeling like you might fail. Write honestly — this is for you.
